## üìù Repository Settings

### General
- **Description**: High-performance web framework for Node.js built on Web Standards
- **Website**: https://github.com/Ameriq8/curisjs
- **Topics**: See above
- **Visibility**: Public
- **Features**:
  - ‚úÖ Issues
  - ‚úÖ Discussions
  - ‚úÖ Projects
  - ‚úÖ Wiki (optional)
  - ‚úÖ Releases
  - ‚úÖ Packages

### Branches
- **Default branch**: `main`
- **Branch protection rules**:
  - Require pull request reviews
  - Require status checks to pass
  - Require conversation resolution
  - Include administrators

### Pages (Optional)
- **Source**: Deploy from GitHub Actions
- **Custom domain**: (optional)

### Security
- ‚úÖ Enable Dependabot alerts
- ‚úÖ Enable Dependabot security updates
- ‚úÖ Enable private vulnerability reporting

### Integrations
- Code scanning with CodeQL
- Codecov for coverage reports (optional)

## üöÄ Initial Setup Commands

After creating the repository on GitHub:

```bash
cd /home/amer/Desktop/Studio/CurisJS

# Initialize git (if not already done)
git init

# Add remote
git remote add origin https://github.com/Ameriq8/curisjs.git

# Add all files
git add .

# Commit
git commit -m "üéâ Initial commit: CurisJS v0.1.0

- Core framework with radix/trie router
- Node.js adapter
- Middleware system
- Validation system
- Backend template
- Comprehensive documentation
- GitHub templates and workflows
"

# Create main branch
git branch -M main

# Push to GitHub
git push -u origin main

# Create develop branch
git checkout -b develop
git push -u origin develop
```

## üìã Post-Publication Checklist

### On GitHub
- [ ] Create repository
- [ ] Add description and topics
- [ ] Enable Discussions
- [ ] Enable Issues
- [ ] Configure branch protection
- [ ] Enable Dependabot
- [ ] Enable GitHub Sponsors (if desired)
- [ ] Add repository to profile README

### Documentation
- [ ] Update all links to point to actual repository
- [ ] Add SECURITY.md email contact
- [ ] Create GitHub Pages (optional)
- [ ] Add badges to README

### Community
- [ ] Star your own repository
- [ ] Share on social media
- [ ] Post on Reddit (r/javascript, r/node, r/typescript)
- [ ] Post on Dev.to
- [ ] Post on Hashnode
- [ ] Submit to awesome-lists

### Publishing
- [ ] Create GitHub release v0.1.0
- [ ] Publish to npm (optional)
- [ ] Add to TypeScript registry

### Monitoring
- [ ] Set up repository insights
- [ ] Monitor issues and PRs
- [ ] Respond to community feedback
